page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: News items influenced the conclusions: {Locally} employment was the main concern, although statistics showed only 6% of residents unemployed. Other concerns were education, vandalism, graffiti, drug abuse(including smoking and alcohol), state of roads and nursery provision.{Nationally}finding work is the main concern for school leavers. Others were trade unions and strikes, football violence, nuclear weapons, capital punishment, racial prejudice, child battering and the National Health Service. {Internationally}terrorism, drug smuggling, African famine,the Middle East,apartheid,the EEC and Britain were important.{ {Solutions:Attitudes;}Lack of regard by all ages to the environment and others needs more positive discipline from parents, teachers and authorities.
